The adrenal glands play a crucial role in the stress response.
"  When the body perceives stress, the adrenal glands release hormones.

Sentence: These hormones, primarily adrenaline and cortisol, prepare the body for a fight-or-flight response.
Adrenaline increases heart rate and blood pressure, providing immediate energy.
Cortisol helps sustain this heightened state by regulating metabolism and reducing inflammation.
The regulation of these hormones is crucial to ensure the body can return to normal after the stressor is gone.
The hypothalamus, pituitary gland, and adrenal glands work together in a feedback loop to control the release of these hormones.
This system is known as the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis. "
The balance of these hormones is essential for maintaining homeostasis and preventing prolonged stress, which can lead to health issues.
If the stress response is not properly regulated, it can result in chronic stress, affecting mood, immune function, and overall health.
Therefore, understanding and maintaining the regulation of adrenal hormones is vital for managing stress effectively.
